Basic details: Michael Thompson, a 61-year-old male, comes to the clinic for a follow-up on his hypertension.
Vitals:
BP: 150/95 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation: Sit calmly in the chair, occasionally rubbing your temples as if experiencing a mild headache. Mention feeling more tired than usual over the past few weeks. If asked about medication adherence, respond that you sometimes forget to take your pills.
Challenging question: "Why do I need to keep taking these medications if I feel fine most of the time?"
